verses.verse: (Song 6:8) Kings’ daughters are among Your honorable women; (1 Kin. 2:19) At Your right hand stands the queen in gold from Ophir.
Listen, O daughter, Consider and incline your ear; (Deut. 21:13; Ruth 1:16, 17) Forget your own people also, and your father’s house;
So the King will greatly desire your beauty; (Ps. 95:6; (Is. 54:5)) Because He is your Lord, worship Him.
And the daughter of Tyre will come with a gift; (Is. 49:23) The rich among the people will seek your favor.
The royal daughter is all glorious within the palace; Her clothing is woven with gold.
(Song 1:4) She shall be brought to the King in robes of many colors; The virgins, her companions who follow her, shall be brought to You.
With gladness and rejoicing they shall be brought; They shall enter the King’s palace.
Instead of Your fathers shall be Your sons, ((1 Pet. 2:9; Rev. 1:6; 20:6)) Whom You shall make princes in all the earth.
(Mal. 1:11) I will make Your name to be remembered in all generations; Therefore the people shall praise You forever and ever.

God the Refuge of His People and Conqueror of the Nations To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of the sons of Korah. A Song (1 Chr. 15:20) for Alamoth. [1] God is our (Ps. 62:7, 8) refuge and strength, ((Deut. 4:7; Ps. 145:18)) A very present help in trouble.
Therefore we will not fear, Even though the earth be removed, And though the mountains be carried into the midst of the sea;
